title: Man shows up at police station with a body in his car and confesses to killing FOUR relatives
text:
A man from Northern California has been arrested on suspicion of killing four members of his family after he showed up at a police station with a body in his car and made a confession.

Police in Mount Shasta say the suspect turned himself in at around 12.11pm on Monday and told authorities he had killed people at his apartment in Roseville, more than 200 miles away.

One of the deceased, a man, was found dead in the suspect's sedan parked outside the police station.

Scroll down for video

Chilling: A man drove this red Mazda seen covered with a tarp to the Mt Shasta Police Department in California and confessed to killing four relatives, one of whom was in the car

Cops were then dispatched to the suspect's home more than 200 miles away in Roseville, California, and found the bodies of the other three victims

Roseville police were then notified and went to the suspect's apartment in the 1800 block of Junction Boulevard, where they discovered three additional bodies.

Sgt. Robert Gibson, of the Mount Shasta Police Department, told the New York Times the quadruple homicide suspect said all victims were his relatives.

The names of the suspect and the victims, and details of the killings have not been released as of Tuesday morning.

It is unclear at this time what prompted the alleged killer to drive 228 miles from Roseville to Mount Shasta to give himself up.

The Roseville Police Department has taken the lead in the investigation and is planning to hold a press conference at 10am local time to provide an update on this case, reported CBS13.

Police do not know why the quadruple homicide suspect traveled 228 miles from Roseville to Mt Shasta to turn himself in on Monday

'The sole suspect involved in this incident is in custody and we do not believe there is any ongoing threat to the community,' the agency said in a statement on Monday.

Gibson, with the Mount Shasta police, told the Times that the suspect was very calm and 'matter of fact.'

'He just came in and told our dispatcher that I want to confess to a murder, and then just gave it up,' Gibson told the newspaper. 'I have never had someone come in with a body and turn themselves in here. This was unusual for us.'

According to the sergeant, at first police did not believe the man, but then he handed them the keys to his red Mazda with the body inside.
description: A Northern California man has been arrested on suspicion of killing four family members after he showed up at a police station more than 200 miles away from his home with a body in his car.
